title: 111_hr5756
content: The "Training and Research for Autism Improvements Nationwide Act of 2010" or the "TRAIN Act of 2010" establishes University Centers for Excellence initiatives on Autism Spectrum Disorders, providing grants and technical assistance for autism research and training programs. The Secretary awards multiyear grants to University Centers for Excellence in Developmental Disabilities Education, Research, and Service to provide interdisciplinary training, education, technical assistance, and information to improve services for individuals on the autism spectrum and their families. The University Centers for Excellence in Developmental Disabilities Education, Research, and Service must demonstrate capacity to provide training and technical assistance in evidence-based practices for individuals on the autism spectrum and their families to receive a grant under this section. The University Centers for Excellence in Developmental Disabilities Education, Research, and Service must provide opportunities for individuals on the autism spectrum and their families to advise and direct activities under the grant. They should also share effective materials and practices, and offer training, technical assistance, interventions, services, treatments, and supports statewide. The Center must ensure a balance of interdisciplinary didactic and community-based experiences for trainees, and provide data on the outcomes of training and technical assistance. Training, technical assistance, dissemination of information, and services should align with the goals of the program. The Center must ensure training programs align with the goals of relevant acts and involve individuals on the autism spectrum and their families, as well as coordinate with State agencies and service providers. The University Center for Excellence in Developmental Disabilities Education, Research, and Service must receive a grant of at least $250,000 per fiscal year. The Secretary may allocate up to 2% of the funds for technical assistance to a national organization for dissemination of information and best practices from training programs. The University Center for Excellence in Developmental Disabilities Education, Research, and Service awarded grants will compile and disseminate effective training strategies, assist in coordinating grantee activities, and develop a Web portal for access to training modules and materials. The University Center for Excellence in Developmental Disabilities Education, Research, and Service awarded grants will develop materials for policymakers on training and support for individuals on the autism spectrum, convene experts to discuss training issues, and undertake functions as determined by the Secretary. Authorization of $17,000,000 for each year is provided for these purposes. $17,000,000 authorized for fiscal years 2012-2016. SEC. 158. CAPACITY BUILDING GRANTS. The Secretary will award multiyear grants to University Centers for Excellence in Developmental Disabilities to collaborate with minority institutions, provide services to individuals on the autism spectrum from minority populations, conduct research and education focused on minority populations, and build capacity within these institutions. The Secretary will award grants to University Centers for Excellence in Developmental Disabilities to collaborate with minority institutions, prioritize applicants with demonstrated capacity to serve individuals on the autism spectrum, allocate $1,000,000 for fiscal years 2012 through 2016. "SEC. 159. DEFINITIONS." In this section, interventions refer to educational methods and positive behavioral support strategies for autism spectrum disorder. Minority institution is defined as per the Higher Education Act of 1965. Services are assistance for individuals with autism to live independently, while treatments are health services to improve symptoms. Amendments include changing "subtitle" to "part" in section 152(a)(1). Amendments are made to change "subtitle" to "part" in various sections of the Developmental Disabilities Assistance and Bill of Rights Act of 2000. The table of contents is also amended to reflect these changes. The House of Representatives passed the University Centers for Excellence Initiatives on Autism Spectrum Disorders, including grants and technical assistance for autism spectrum disorders, capacity building grants, and definitions.
